0.name: stepperContext
0.documentation: The stepper context as PropTypes to be consumed by React
0.value:
{
  pages: PropTypes.array,
  currentPage: PropTypes.number,
  canAdvance: PropTypes.bool,
  canFinish: PropTypes.bool,
  canReverse: PropTypes.bool,
  setPageIndex: PropTypes.func,
}

1.name: Context
1.documentation:
The context that is avalible inside a stepper and is
consumed by the various UI components

properties.name: onEnter
properties.documentation:
Callback when the page is about to be set as active.

If a Promise is returned, it will be awaited before the page is actived.
This is not called when the stepper is first rendered.

properties.name: onLeave
properties.documentation:
Callback when the page is about the be left.

If a Promise is returned, it will be awaited before the next page is actived.
If false or a promise that resolves to false is returned the navigation is aborted.

properties.name: onAdvance
properties.documentation:
Callback when the page is about the be left for a subsequent page.

If a Promise is returned, it will be awaited before the next page is actived.
If false or a promise that resolves to false is returned the navigation is aborted.

properties.name: onReverse
properties.documentation:
Callback when the page is about the be left for a preceding page.

If a Promise is returned, it will be awaited before the next page is actived.
If false or a promise that resolves to false is returned the navigation is aborted.

properties.name: canAdvance
properties.documentation: Controls whenever the page is allow to be left for a subsequent page.

properties.name: canReverse
properties.documentation: Controls whenever the page is allow to be left for a preceding page.

properties.name: render
properties.documentation:
A function to render when this page is active, takes precedence over
component if both is set.

properties.name: component
properties.documentation:
The component to render when this page is active. Either component or
render must be specified.

5.name: withStepper
5.documentation: A HOC to inject the stepperContext as properties

properties.name: component
properties.documentation: The component to render, it defaults to a browser <button> element.

properties.name: onFinish
properties.documentation: Callback when the button is used to finish the stepper

properties.name: onNext
properties.documentation: Callback when the button is used to go to the next page

properties.name: finishLabel
properties.documentation:
A label to show instead of the children when the stepper
is on the last page.

7.name: AdvanceButton
7.documentation:
Renders a button to go to the next step

### Usage
```
<AdvanceButton>
   Next
</AdvanceButton>
```

properties.name: component
properties.documentation: The component to render, it defaults to a browser <button> element.

properties.name: onCancel
properties.documentation: Callback when the button is used to cancel the stepper

properties.name: onPrevious
properties.documentation: Callback when the button is used to go to the previous page

properties.name: cancelLabel
properties.documentation:
A label to show instead of the children when the stepper
is on the first page.

9.name: ReverseButton
9.documentation:
Renders a button to go to the previous step

### Usage
```
<ReverseButton>
   Back
</ReverseButton>
```

14.name: Circle
14.documentation: A simple circle, used for step icons and by the dot tracker.

15.name: onKeyboardClick
15.documentation: A function to filter keyboard events to spacebar and Enter

16.name: ClickableRow
16.documentation: A flexbox row that is focusable and clickable like a button

17.name: VerticalLine
17.documentation: A simple vertical line, used for constructing the vertical stepper

18.name: DotTracker
18.documentation:
A component for tracking the current and total pages
using dots.

### Usage
```
<DotTracker />
```

19.name: StepTitle
19.documentation:
A component that display the title of the active page.

### Usage
```
<StepTitle />
```

properties.name: index
properties.documentation: The page index to set as active page

properties.name: onChange
properties.documentation:
Called when the page changes. If this is passed, the Stepper
becomes controlled and will expect the parent to maintain the state and update
the index property appropriately.

properties.name: allowJumpBack
properties.documentation: Allow reversing more than one step at a time

properties.name: allowJumpAhead
properties.documentation: Allow advancing more than one step at a time

22.name: Stepper
22.documentation:
The component where a stepper is configured and holds all state
and logic for navigating a stepper.

It does not render any UI by itself and must be accompanied by
UI components like the DotTracker, Advance and Reverse Buttons or others.

### Usage
```
<Stepper pages={[{component: PageOne}, {component: PageTwo}]}>
  <StepperView />
  <Row>
    <ReverseButton>Back</ReverseButton>
    <DotTracker />
    <AdvanceButton>Next</AdvanceButton>
  </Row>
</Stepper>
```

properties.name: index
properties.documentation: The page index to set as active page

properties.name: onChange
properties.documentation:
Called when the page changes. If this is passed, the Stepper
becomes controlled and will expect the parent to maintain the state and update
the index property appropriately.

properties.name: allowJumpBack
properties.documentation: Allow reversing more than one step at a time

properties.name: allowJumpAhead
properties.documentation: Allow advancing more than one step at a time

23.name: StepperView
23.documentation: Renders the active page in the stepper

24.name: TextTracker
24.documentation:
A component for tracking the current and total pages
using a text.

### Usage
```
<TextTracker />
```

### Options
The default behavior is to render a tect in the format `Step 1 of 2`.
To render in a different format, pass a function in the generateText property
that takes the current and total number of pages as arguments and returns
the text to be rendered.

For example
```
(current, total) => `${current + 1} / ${total}`
```
will render `1 / 2`. Note that the current page is zero based.

25.name: AdvanceButton
25.documentation:
Renders a react-toolbox Button to go to the next step

This is just a wrapper around the basic [AdvanceButton](/#/docs/dist/src/buttons.js/component.AdvanceButton)
but with Button from react-toolbox passed in the component property.

### Usage
```
<AdvanceButton>
   Next
</AdvanceButton>
```

26.name: ReverseButton
26.documentation:
Renders a react-toolbox Button to go to the previous step

This is just a wrapper around the basic [ReverseButton](/#/docs/dist/src/buttons.js/component.ReverseButton)
but with Button from react-toolbox passed in the component property.

### Usage
```
<ReverseButton>
   Back
</ReverseButton>
```

28.name: AlertIcon
28.documentation:
An material warning icon to use for steps that needs the
users attention.

29.name: DoneIcon
29.documentation:
A material check icon in a circle to use for steps that
are completed.

30.name: StepNumber
30.documentation: A circle with the step number to use for most steps.

31.name: StepCircle
31.documentation: Renders the appropriate step icon for the current status.

33.name: StepHeader
33.documentation:
A step header after [material design](https://material.io/guidelines/components/steppers.html#steppers-specs)
renders a step icon and title. Used for building material design based steppers.

36.name: VerticalStepper
36.documentation:
A component that renders the mobile version of the vertical stepper
from the [material design guidlines](https://material.io/guidelines/components/steppers.html#steppers-types-of-steppers)

readmes.dist/src/react-toolbox:
### react-toolbox
This contains stepper components that are based on [react-toolbox](http://react-toolbox.com).
They use material design and do overall provide a more polished feeling.
readmes.dist/src:
# react-step
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/beanloop/react-step.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/beanloop/react-step)
[![npm version](https://badge.fury.io/js/react-step.svg)](https://badge.fury.io/js/react-step)
[![License](http://img.shields.io/:license-mit-blue.svg)](http://doge.mit-license.org)

A package of React components to easily build advanced steppers.

## Install
```
yarn add react-step
npm install --save react-step
```

## Documentation
For examples and API documentation please see
<https://beanloop.github.io/react-step/>

## License
react-step is dual-licensed under Apache 2.0 and MIT terms.
